oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. John Baptist Church: rear and side facades
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 2401 Carlos Ave SW, Birmingham, Jefferson County, AL
Black and white photograph of the rear (south) and east facades of the church complex, showing the cross-gabled sanctuary building with flat-roofed additions at rear and west side.

St. John Baptist Church, originally built in 1910, is a locally significant property associated with the Alabama Christian Movement for Human Rights and the Civil Rights Movement in Birmingham from 1956 to 1963. Its leaders Rev. Joseph C. Crosby and Rev. Ambus Hill were both active in the ACMHR, and the church hosted mass meetings for the organization.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
Churches
